intro: Actinotus suffocata, commonly known as the suffocating actinotus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Actinotus suffocata is notable for its unique appearance and ecological significance in its native range.
